items.title: Loan-deposit ratio to stay high, banks set to go for CDs, bonds
items.summary: The pace of rise in bank profitability is likely to bottom out this fiscal year, and gradually improve in FY27 as funding pressures ease and net interest margins (NIMs) stabilise, the agency said in its outlook on the financial sector for FY27.

items.title: Risky Borrowers Flood Market to Tap Investor Hunger for Yield
items.summary: While the broader markets have flinched at every political tremor, the world of risky debt is acting like almost nothing’s wrong.

items.title: Navi Mumbai airport rebuts telcos, says mobile connectivity is fully available
items.summary: Navi Mumbai International Airport Ltd (NMIAL) denies claims that mobile connectivity is unavailable at the upcoming airport. NMIAL defends its neutral-host telecom infrastructure, stating it ensures uniform coverage and operational efficiency. The airport operator also refutes allegations regarding high access charges and Right of Way denials. NMIAL remains committed to working with stakeholders for secure and efficient connectivity.

items.title: CGHS beneficiaries get optional health insurance plan
items.summary: Central Government Health Scheme beneficiaries now have a new optional health insurance plan. The Paripoorna Mediclaim Ayush Bima offers in-patient hospitalisation coverage up to ₹20 lakh. This plan provides enhanced financial security and access to quality healthcare across India. Beneficiaries can choose co-payment options of 70:30 or 50:50. The policy is available at discounted premiums compared to regular plans.

items.title: ​Moving on: On India’s Consumer Price Index and a new base year
items.summary: India is getting rid of an outdated dataset for measuring inflation

items.title: Gold, silver extend record-breaking rallies as uncertainty persists
items.summary: GLOBAL-PRECIOUS:Gold, silver extend record-breaking rallies as uncertainty persists

items.title: Delhi HC quashes I-T order to EY on withholding tax
items.summary: The Delhi High Court has overturned an Income Tax Department ruling concerning Ernst & Young. The court ordered a fresh review of Ernst & Young's request for a nil withholding certificate. This pertains to a payment of 1,750 crore rupees to its UK-based entity. The tax department had previously rejected the plea, citing a virtual permanent establishment in India.

items.title: Hong Kong emerges key market for India's high-value exports
items.summary: India's exports to Hong Kong are surging. Shipments of silver jewellery, electronics, and processed stones have seen substantial growth. Cut and polished diamonds are leading this increase. This trend highlights Hong Kong's growing importance as a trading hub for India. Diversification of exports is a key factor. Electronics and silver jewellery exports have more than doubled.

items.title: Wholesale inflation hits 8-month high of 0.8% in December
items.summary: Wholesale prices have exited deflation. Inflation reached an eight-month high of 0.83% in December. This shift was driven by stable food prices and rising costs for manufactured goods. Retail inflation also saw an increase. Experts note base effects and stable prices contributed to the wholesale inflation rate. The commerce ministry highlighted increases in various manufacturing sectors.

items.title: Indian Overseas Bank Q3 net surges 56% to ₹1,365 crore
Telcos turn to Trai on network issue at Navi Mumbai Airport
items.summary: Leading telecom operators have lodged a complaint with TRAI. They allege the Navi Mumbai airport operator is creating a monopolistic in-building telecom setup. This arrangement is reportedly exclusive and costly for travelers. The operators seek TRAI intervention to ensure fair pricing and non-discriminatory access to public infrastructure for connectivity.

items.title: Hinduja Renewables to expand capacity 3X to 10 GW, invest $4 billion
items.summary: Hinduja Renewables Energy plans a significant $4 billion investment to triple its renewable capacity to 10 GW, pivoting towards wind power and energy storage. The company is expanding into hybrid solar-wind projects and developing substantial pumped hydro storage capacity to meet India's demand for round-the-clock green power.

items.title: BookMyShow posts Rs 192 crore profit on robust live events business
items.summary: Big Tree Entertainment, operating BookMyShow, saw its net profit surge to '192 crore in FY25. This growth stems from a robust performance in its ticketing and live events segments. The company's total income also increased significantly. Live events, including music festivals and concerts, played a key role in this expansion. BookMyShow's online ticketing business remained its largest revenue source.

items.title: January 15 bank holiday in select regions—See city-wise list and services you can still use
items.summary: The bank holiday on January 15 is associated with Makara Sankranti, a large Hindu festival which is celebrated in different ways all over India under various names. The moment when the Sun enters the Capricorn (Makara) zodiac sign marks the beginning of the Uttarayana period, when the Sun starts moving northward.

items.title: Delhi HC restores ban on 2 diabetes FDCs
items.summary: The Delhi High Court has made waves with its recent judgment, reinstating a ban on two fixed-dose combination drugs for managing Type II Diabetes Mellitus, significantly affecting leading pharmaceutical corporations. The ruling reaffirmed the government's power to eliminate drugs deemed risky to health.

items.title: Film funding deals now come wrapped in fine print
items.summary: Film studios are now acting more like moneylenders than co-producers. They are imposing tougher terms in film deals. This shift comes as many movies struggle to recover costs at the box office. Studios are focusing on safeguarding their capital. Producers now bear more risk, while studios maintain significant control over films and their intellectual property.

items.title: Eutelsat's OneWeb to power Navy's Kaundinya Voyage
items.summary: Eutelsat is providing OneWeb's low earth orbit satellite connectivity for the Indian Navy's Project Kaundinya. This maritime voyage traces historic trade routes from Porbandar to Muscat. The traditional vessel lacks standard communication systems, making satellite links essential. OneWeb's technology offers high-speed internet for real-time communication, crew welfare, and maritime security.

items.title: Tariff risks keep long-term US auto parts orders away
items.summary: Indian auto parts makers are experiencing a slowdown in long-term orders from the US. This is due to uncertainty over potential tariffs imposed by the US administration. Automakers in the US and neighboring countries are hesitant to finalize import supply contracts. The industry faces challenges absorbing increased tariff costs.

items.title: Bajaj Auto eyes top spot in EV scooter segment this year
items.summary: Bajaj Auto is targeting the top spot in India's electric scooter market this calendar year. The company is focusing on a refined product strategy and making electric mobility more affordable and reliable. Rishab Bajaj, son of MD Rajiv Bajaj, expressed hope for leadership. The introduction of the Chetak C25 model further strengthens their electric scooter offerings for urban consumers.

items.title: CII urges govt to issue mandate on Green Hydrogen
items.summary: The Confederation of Indian Industry is pushing for government mandates on green hydrogen. This aims to increase its use in sectors like refining and fertilisers. Such measures would help bridge the cost gap with grey hydrogen. Incentives and phased mandates are proposed. This follows a record year for India's clean energy capacity.

items.title: Mercedes-Benz India sales fall 1st time in 5 years
items.summary: In 2025, Mercedes-Benz India faced its first sales decline in half a decade, attributed to heightened competition and currency volatility, which resulted in increased pricing. Despite strong demand for high-end models, the core segment took a hit. Meanwhile, BMW capitalized on these shifts with notable sales growth. While luxury cars remain in demand, potential buyers are increasingly worried about affordability.

items.title: Indian Oil targets 20-30% revenue from non-fuel biz by 2030: AS Sahney, Chairman
items.summary: Indian Oil Corporation is embarking on an exciting journey to enhance its non-fuel portfolio. With a vision to generate 20-30% of its revenue from emerging sectors such as gas, petrochemicals, lubricants, and renewable energy by 2030, the company is set to elevate its non-fuel business to an estimated ₹2-3 lakh crore.

items.title: NHAI launches pilot to warn drivers of stray cattle on high-risk highway stretches
items.summary: To ensure effective communication, safety advisories during the pilot phase will be delivered through a Flash SMS, followed by a voice alert.

items.title: Mahindra XEV 9S and XUV 7XO record 93,689 bookings worth ₹20,500 crore
SRA norms tightened to mandate freezing sale flats to secure rehab dues
items.summary: The Slum Rehabilitation Authority (SRA) has mandated early-stage freezing of free-sale inventory in slum redevelopment projects. This move aims to secure transit rent payments and permanent alternate accommodation obligations for eligible slum dwellers. Developers must now formally earmark and list these frozen flats, limiting their sale or encumbrance until rehabilitation is complete and all dues are cleared.

items.title: Enhanced tax sops for R&D, easier access to export credit high on pharma sector Budget wish list
Essar Energy Transition posts record domestic sales at Stanlow refinery in 2025
items.summary: Essar Energy Transition achieved record domestic fuel sales in 2025 at its Stanlow refinery. Strong UK demand and an expanded supply network fueled this success. Retail and aviation sectors saw significant growth. Investments in infrastructure and decarbonization are ongoing. The company advocates for refining inclusion in the UK's Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism to ensure a competitive domestic sector.

items.title: New forex risk capital rules from April 2027
items.summary: RBI has proposed significant changes to how banks manage their foreign exchange exposure. These updates aim to align Indian regulations with global Basel standards, simplifying calculations by merging offshore and onshore positions. The move also includes treating gold separately and exempting certain structural forex holdings, ensuring consistent application across all financial institutions.

items.title: Dr Reddy's launches generic OTC ophthalmic solution in US market
items.summary: Dr Reddy's Laboratories has launched a new eye drop in the United States. This over-the-counter solution treats itchy eyes. It is an antihistamine eye drop. The company received approval from the US Food and Drug Administration. This launch expands their existing eye care products. It highlights their ability to bring store-brand equivalents to the US market.

items.title: Finance Ministry launches ₹20 lakh Paripoorna Mediclaim Ayush Bima for CGHS beneficiaries
items.summary: Available as a retail product, the policy provides in-patient hospitalisation coverage within India with flexible co-payment options and discounted premiums

RBI proposes changes to banks' forex positions
items.summary: The amendments focus on the net open position, which measures banks’ exposure to currency fluctuations.

items.title: Silver rate today climbs to new peak as US Supreme Court extends Trump's tariff decision. Will silver touch $100/oz?
items.summary: Silver prices at COMEX climbed to hit a fresh all-time high during Wednesday's commodity market session as the US Supreme Court decided to extend the decision on US President Donald Trump's tariffs. Here's what investors need to know.

items.title: What is the new composite salary account for central employees? Banking and insurance benefits explained
items.summary: The government has launched a Composite Salary Account Package for Central Government employees, combining banking, insurance and card benefits into a single, standardised framework. Rolled out through public sector banks, the package offers zero-balance salary accounts, concessional loans, enhanced insurance cover and digital benefits. The move aims to simplify financial management, improve social security and strengthen employee welfare in line with the vision of Viksit Bharat 2047.

items.summary: Emerges winner in the ‘Best Fintech & DPI Adoption’ category

items.summary: This launch adds to its current portfolio in the OTC eye-care space, including Olopatadine Hydrochloride Ophthalmic Solution

items.summary: Fund house HDFC AMC has staged a strong financial performance for the final three months of 2025, with a better-than-exepcted 20 per cent rise in its net profit.

items.title: Bajaj Auto eyes no. 1 position in e-scooter segment in India and abroad
items.summary: Bajaj Auto aims for the number one position in the e-scooter segment, both domestically and internationally, with its electric scooter Chetak. The company has launched the new Chetak C25, priced at Rs 91,399, offering a range of up to 113 km and premium features, catering to diverse urban mobility needs.

items.title: Bajaj Auto eyes no. 1 position in e-scooter segment in India and abroad

items.summary: APEDA resumes non-Basmati rice exports to the Philippines and Senegal after lifting import restrictions.

items.title: EPC boom powers Waaree Renewable’s Q3 profit up 124% to ₹120 crore
items.summary: The solar EPC arm of Waaree Group saw its revenues from operations during the quarter rise 136% year-on-year to ₹851 crore, fuelled by a 138% rise in revenues from EPC contracts and a 21 growth from sale of power.

items.title: Brokerages flag volume rebound, margin expansion for Britannia in Q3 FY26
items.summary: Project around 7 per cent year-on-year growth in biscuit volumes, 11.4 per cent revenue growth, margin expansion and nearly 22 per cent growth in profit

items.title: Coca-Cola elevates India chief Sanket Ray to oversee key Asian markets
items.summary: Coca-Cola has expanded the role of Sanket Ray, its India and Southwest Asia president, to now include Greater China, Mongolia, Japan, and South Korea. This move, effective March 31, is part of broader leadership changes aimed at focusing on key Asian markets. Ray's extensive regional experience is seen as crucial for tapping into growth potential in these dynamic territories.

items.title: Hatsun Agro issues warning to CFO over whatsapp leak of draft financial statements
items.summary: Hatsun Agro cautioned CFO H. Ramachandran after he accidentally leaked sensitive financial info on WhatsApp, prompting trading restrictions for insiders.

items.title: Mercedes-Benz begins local production of Maybach GLS in Pune; first outside US
items.summary: The decision underscores India’s growing strategic importance for Mercedes-Benz, with the country now among the top five global markets for Mercedes-Maybach

items.title: CII urges govt to issue directives, incentives to fuel India's green hydrogen aspirations
items.summary: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) is pushing the government for green hydrogen mandates with incentives. This move aims to boost demand and foster a clean economy. CII suggests blending green hydrogen in sectors like refining and fertilisers. They also propose cost-offset mechanisms and public procurement of green hydrogen products.

items.title: Shareholders approve Shriram Finance’s MUFG deal proposal
items.summary: Under the terms of the deal signed last month, MUFG will acquire 20 per cent stake in Shriram Finance for $4.4 billion

items.title: Bank deposits and loans soared in the last fortnight of Q3FY26
items.summary: In the fortnight ended December 31, 2025, deposits of all scheduled banks soared by ₹7,34,623.39 crore

items.title: RBI tightens complaint review norms, strengthens role of internal ombudsman
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India has enhanced its review mechanism for customer complaints within regulated entities, mandating a senior-level review before rejection or partial resolution. This move aims to ensure speedy and meaningful grievance redressal, with internal ombudsmen playing a key role in oversight and reporting to the board's customer service committee.

items.title: Tata Sons’ listing in limbo as RBI yet to decide on upper layer status
items.summary: Tata Sons, which holds significant stakes in various Tata Group companies, wants to remain private and not list

items.title: US retail sales beat expectations in November on holiday boost
items.summary: American shoppers spent more in November. Retail sales saw a 0.6 percent increase, beating forecasts. This rise signals a stronger start to the holiday shopping season than anticipated.

items.title: Samsung explores smartphone-like upgrade platform for home appliances customers in India
items.summary: Samsung is exploring a smartphone-like upgrade platform for its home appliances in India, inspired by its Galaxy Forever Plan. This initiative aims to make premium appliances more affordable for aspirational customers through a lease-style model, allowing them to trade in older models for newer ones. The company is studying optimal usage periods and certification processes for this new trade-in concept.

items.title: Bajaj Mobility AG to cut 500 jobs as part of global rightsizing initiative
items.summary: Austria-based Bajaj Mobility AG (formerly PIERER Mobility AG) is the holding company of the KTM Group, one of Europe's leading motorcycle manufacturers.

items.title: India slips to third among Russian fossil fuel buyers amid sanctions; December imports hit lowest level since price cap — Key factors
items.summary: India slipped to third place among buyers of Russian fossil fuels in December after its imports fell sharply to €2.3 billion from €3.3 billion in November, according to CREA. Crude oil imports dropped 29 per cent month-on-month, led by a pullback from Reliance Industries and state-run refiners, amid tighter price caps, fresh US sanctions and higher compliance risks. While Russia still accounts for a significant share of India’s crude basket, the data point to a cautious recalibration as geopolitical pressures reshape global energy trade flows.

items.title: No mandate from govt on source code sharing, says MAIT
items.summary: The Ministry of Electronics and IT (MeitY) has not mandated source code sharing for IT hardware manufacturers, according to industry body MAIT. A recent government memorandum clarifies this, superseding earlier interpretations and safeguarding intellectual property. MeitY is currently consulting with stakeholders on mobile safety and security requirements.

items.title: US bank stocks fall as results, credit card cap in focus
items.summary: US bank stocks fell as investors digested mixed earnings from major lenders and concerns over a proposed credit card interest cap, which could pressure profitability, despite strong loan growth and optimism about longer-term lending momentum.

items.title: Earnings preview: RIL’s Q3 show seen driven by O2C, digital biz
items.summary: The Mukesh Ambani-controlled conglomerate is seen reporting EBITDA in the region of ₹43,789 crore, up 10.6 per cent on year, with gross refining margin estimated at $13.4/bbl, compared to $10.4/bbl in the year-ago period

items.title: US Fed's Neel Kashkari says it is 'way too soon' to cut rates
items.summary: Minneapolis Federal ‍Reserve President Neel Kashkari did ​not want to cut interest rates last month ⁠and sees no need to cut them any time soon given labor market resilience and inflation above the Fed's target, the New York Times reported on ‌Wednesday.

items.title: Infosys ADRs fall 2% as Q3 profit dip, margin pressure offset guidance upgrade
items.summary: Infosys ADRs fell as December-quarter results showed modest profit decline and sharp margin pressure, offset by strong revenue growth and an upgraded FY26 guidance, reassuring investors despite cost headwinds, labour code impact and near-term seasonal softness in global IT markets.

items.title: RBI recognises FEDAI as an SRO
items.summary: FEDAI has been given one year to bring its functioning and governance framework in line with the Omnibus SRO framework

items.title: Iran unrest rattles dry fruits trade, fresh produce holds firm

items.title: Gold rates today: MCX gold rises  ₹1,350 per 10g, silver surges  ₹16,220 per kg on geopolitical tensions
items.summary: Gold and silver prices reached record highs amid strong investor demand due to Middle East tensions. February gold futures rose to  ₹1,43,590 while March silver contracts hit  ₹2,91,406, continuing their bullish momentum from last year.

items.title: Japanese Bank SMBC gets RBI in-principle approval to expand operations as wholly owned subsidiary
items.summary: In a statement, the RBI said the approval allows SMBC to move from its current branch-based operations to a locally incorporated subsidiary. Until now, the bank has been operating in India through branch mode.

items.title: Amagi IPO Day 2: Issue sees muted investor interest—Here’s what you need to know
items.summary: Amagi Media Labs, established in 2008, provides the infrastructure for streaming and monetisation of digital video content through a cloud-based software as a service (SaaS) model for media companies. It is the firm that makes the digital and physical media alike connected to the viewers and users who are scattered around smart TVs, mobile phones, and digital platforms.

items.title: India, China hold talks to improve bilateral ties; people-centric engagement, trade in focus
items.summary: India and China held talks in New Delhi on Wednesday to assess progress in stabilising bilateral relations, with a focus on people-centric engagement and trade. Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri and Chinese Vice Minister Sun Haiyan discussed steps to rebuild trust, enhance exchanges and advance ties gradually. Both sides reiterated their commitment to leaders’ directions and supported engagement through platforms such as BRICS, signalling cautious optimism amid unresolved challenges.

items.title: Wall Street declines as investors digest bank earnings
items.summary: As of 9:45 a.m. Eastern Time, the S&amp;P 500 fell 0.7%, the Dow Jones Industrial Average was down 0.4%, and the Nasdaq Composite was 1% lower.

items.title: Nomura sees inflation gradually edging higher under new CPI series
items.summary: According to the Nomura report, December's headline inflation rose to 1.3 per cent year-on-year from 0.7 per cent in November. While this figure fell below consensus expectations, the uptick was driven by easing food price deflation and the fading of favourable base effects.

This move aims to improve how customer complaints are handled within these financial institutions. The internal ombudsman will review complaints that have already been processed but not fully resolved.

items.title: Deposit accretion structural concern for banks, high CD seen constraining credit growth: Report
items.summary: Indian banks face a structural concern with low deposit growth. This is leading to high credit deposit ratios, which may limit loan growth to 13 percent in FY27. Despite this, the economy is showing signs of recovery. State-owned banks are improving their performance and asset quality. Non-bank finance companies will adopt a cautious approach. Microfinance institutions have overcome recent challenges.

items.summary: Ray will serve as Emerging Large Markets Lead overseeing markets including Greater China, Mongolia, Japan and South Korea effective March 31 while continuing with the role of President of India and Southwest Asia unit

items.title: Domestic travel drives India’s hotel boom; occupancies and room rates seen holding firm in FY26
items.summary: India’s hospitality sector is entering a structurally stronger phase, led by robust domestic travel demand that has reduced dependence on foreign tourists. Premium hotel occupancy is expected to hold at 72–74 per cent in FY26, with average room rates rising to Rs 8,200–8,500. With supply growth lagging demand, pricing power and profitability remain strong, while asset-light operating models and diversified hotel formats are shaping the sector’s next phase of expansion.

The sector wants lower taxes and simpler procedures to compete globally. Proposals include reducing GST on gold and silver jewellery and streamlining customs. These reforms aim to make Indian exports more cost-effective and attract foreign buyers.

items.title: Union Budget 2026: Government plans these key steps to tackle Delhi pollution, say sources

items.title: Union Budget 2026: What is the Economic Survey? All you need to know about key document
items.summary: With the government having set a date of 1 February 2026 for this year's Union Budget, the Economic Survey is expected to be tabled in Parliament a day prior to it. Here's all you need to know about it.

items.title: Union Bank of India shares surge 8% after Q3 results show easing bad loans and steadier profits
items.summary: Union Bank of India shares jumped more than 8% after the state-owned lender reported a stronger December-quarter performance, marked by easing slippages, lower bad loans and a 9% rise in net profit. The results reassured investors on asset quality and capital strength, triggering a sharp rally in the stock.

items.title: Flipkart to double money on Shadowfax investment, to pocket Rs 600 crore profit in IPO
items.summary: Flipkart is set to more than double its investment in Shadowfax as the logistics firm prepares for its IPO next week. With a 14.8% stake, Flipkart’s holding could fetch Rs 929 crore at the top price band, generating a pre-exit gain of over Rs 600 crore while retaining future upside.

items.title: Budget 2026: Real estate sector pins hopes on Affordable Housing revival, tax relief, infrastructure push
items.summary: Budget 2026: The revival of the Section 80-IBA tax holiday is another critical ask. A time-bound reintroduction could quickly incentivize developers to return to the affordable segment, bridging the margin gap and expanding supply.

items.title: Silver soars past $90: Rich Dad Poor Dad author Robert Kiyosaki cheers surge after reaffirming buy zone up to $100
items.summary: Finance author Robert Kiyosaki cheered silver prices surpassing $90 per ounce. He noted US Silver Eagle coins are selling for $104. Silver futures on MCX reached an all-time high of Rs 2,87,990 per kilogram. Geopolitical tensions are supporting precious metals. Kiyosaki previously warned of a potential pullback but continues to buy silver.

items.title: Infosys Q3 Results FY26 Live Updates: Profit slips marginally but revenue rises 9% YoY to Rs 45,479 crore
US tariffs unlikely to hit auto parts industry until FY27: ACMA
items.summary: Auto component industry grow by 7 per cent YoY to ₹3.56 lakh crore in H1 FY26

items.title: Zepto, Swiggy drop '10-minute delivery' claims on govt's order
items.summary: Quick commerce firms Zepto and Swiggy have stopped promoting their services as '10-minute' delivery. This change follows intervention by the Union Labour Ministry. Blinkit, another major player, also removed the contentious claim from its platforms. The ministry had met with these platforms to address concerns regarding delivery timelines.

items.title: Shadowfax Technologies IPO: GMP signals positive listing outlook after price band announcement
items.summary: Shadowfax Technologies' upcoming IPO is generating positive buzz, with grey market premiums indicating a strong listing. The logistics provider, which recently turned profitable, aims to raise Rs 1,907 crore. Investors are watching valuation and execution in a competitive sector, but robust revenue growth and a wide client base offer optimism.

items.title: IHG Hotels & Resorts to scale India presence to over 400 open and in development hotels within 5 years
items.summary: With more than 50 operational hotels and 80 under development, comprising close to 12,000 rooms, IHG Hotels & Resorts said on Wednesday it is set to more than triple its estate in India over the next five years.

items.title: India to grow at 7.5-7.8% this fiscal, 6.6-6.9% in FY27: Deloitte
items.summary: India's economy is set for strong growth this fiscal year, with projections of 7.5 to 7.8 percent. This surge is fueled by festive demand and a thriving services sector. Looking ahead to the next fiscal year, growth is expected to moderate to between 6.6 and 6.9 percent. This adjustment accounts for a higher base and ongoing global uncertainties.

items.title: Raghuram Rajan: Are central banks aiding a doom loop of unsustainable government deficits?
items.summary: As governments pile up debt, central banks insist they are merely managing liquidity. Yet their extraordinary financing of fiscal gaps raises questions about debt sustainability. Even a privileged economy may not be safe from the perils of runaway borrowings.

items.title: Telangana spends ₹16,900 cr to procure 70.82 lakh tonnes of paddy
items.summary: Terming it a milestone in Telangana’s rice procurement history, Civil Supplies and Irrigation Minister N Uttam Kumar Reddy said that the procurement figures included 38.37 lakh tonnes of fine varieties

items.title: These 9 stocks held by over 100 MFs in December surge up to 115%. Do you own any?
items.summary: Strong mutual fund participation continues to signal institutional conviction, with 254 stocks held by over 100 schemes as of December 2025. Many of these stocks have delivered strong FY26 returns, including several multibaggers, highlighting the resilience and momentum often associated with broad-based mutual fund ownership.

items.title: Markets stuck in a holding pattern as earnings and trade clarity remain elusive: Harsha Upadhyaya
items.summary: Indian stock markets are experiencing a subdued start to 2026. Investors are awaiting clearer signals on company earnings and trade negotiations. While GDP growth remains supportive, a strong earnings rebound is not yet visible. Financials are seen as a bright spot.

items.title: Groww Q3 profit declines 28% to ₹547 cr; total income rises 26%
items.summary: Despite the fall in profit, total income during the quarter rose 26 per cent to ₹1,261 crore, compared with ₹1,004 crore in the year-ago period

items.title: LPG use climbs across India as Ujjwala families refill more often: Hardeep Singh Puri
items.summary: India's Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas, Hardeep Singh Puri, took to his social media on Wednesday, highlighting the transformative impact of India's clean cooking initiatives, emphasizing that the true success of the program lies in the regular usage of Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) rather than just the number of connections provided.

items.title: Indian Overseas Bank Q3 results: Net profit jumps 56% YoY to  ₹1,365 crore, NII up 18%
items.summary: IOB Q3 results: The bank posted a 56% year-on-year (YoY) rise in its net profit to  ₹1,365 crore in the December quarter FY26, from  ₹873.6 crore in the same quarter previous year.

items.summary: Blinkit and Zepto have removed the 10-minute delivery claim from branding after Labour Ministry’s nudge

items.title: Swiggy, Zepto rebrands ‘10-minute’ delivery claim after government order
items.summary: The Labour Ministry raised the issue during a closed-door meeting on January 10 with representatives from the three companies, asking them to stop promoting the business as a 10-minute service, sources said

items.title: Budget 2026: How to revive private sector capex to sustain high growth— 4 experts share views
items.summary: As Budget 2026 approaches, experts emphasise the need for strategic measures to boost private sector capital expenditure. With a focus on deregulation, fiscal incentives, and enhancing infrastructure, the government aims to sustain India's economic growth amidst global uncertainties.&nbsp;

items.title: Maharashtra topples Tamil Nadu to become the No.1 export-ready state of India
items.summary: India exports: NITI Aayog’s Export Preparedness Index 2024, released on Wednesday, ranked Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, Gujarat, Uttar Pradesh and Andhra Pradesh as the top five export ready states of India among the large states category while Uttarakhand has topped the list followed by Jammu & Kashmir, Nagaland, Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu and Goa among smaller states, north-eastern states and union territory category of states.

items.title: Devina Mehra: What are men and women good at? Follow the money and it changes
items.summary: Women do a great many things better—but this is acknowledged only so long as the work is unpaid. Once skill turns into income, power or prestige, women are edged out and men step in. From kitchens to coding, the pattern raises questions of social equity and economic growth.

items.title: Armour Security IPO day 1: GMP, subscription status, review, other details about NSE SME IPO
items.summary: Armour Security India's IPO opened on January 14 with only 0.03 times subscription. The price range is set between  ₹55 and  ₹57, aiming to raise  ₹26.51 crore. Allotment is on January 20, with listing expected on January 22.

items.title: Digital Real Estate| Union Budget 2026: What real estate leaders want to see
items.summary: As real estate leaders outline expectations from the Union Budget 2026, key priorities include demand revival, infrastructure-led growth, and greater institutional capital. Stakeholders seek tax incentives for homebuyers, easier financing for developers, SEZ reforms, and measures to boost affordability and sustainable construction, aiming to support balanced and long-term sector growth.

items.title: India to grow at 7.5-7.8% this fiscal: Deloitte
items.summary: Deloitte India expects growth to moderate to 6.6-6.9 per cent in FY2026-27, reflecting a high base and persistent global uncertainties

items.title: Mint Explainer | Why copper will heat up air conditioner prices this summer
items.summary: As copper prices surge, sectors from heating ventilation and air conditioning to electric vehicles (EVs) will feel the pinch.

items.summary: Tata Steel lead Nifty gainers, surging 3.82%

items.title: Executive Centre India gets SEBI nod for ₹2,600 crore IPO
items.summary: Operating in India since 2008, Executive Centre India runs 89 centres across 14 cities in seven countries.

items.title: Vijay Kedia buys stake in smallcap stock that’s down 43% in 1 year. Do you own?
items.summary: Ace investor Vijay Kedia acquired a 1.01% stake in Patel Engineering after the smallcap stock fell over 40% in a year. The infrastructure firm recently secured hydropower and coal mining contracts worth over Rs 2,400 crore.

items.title: Maharashtra leads NITI Aayog's export preparedness index
items.summary: Niti Aayog's Export Preparedness Index 2024 highlights top states for exports. Maharashtra leads, followed by Tamil Nadu and Gujarat. Uttarakhand tops smaller states. The index assesses export policies, infrastructure, and outcomes. Strong domestic foundations are crucial as India expands trade agreements. States are strengthening export visions through policies and infrastructure. Exports drive economic growth and global competitiveness.

items.title: Wholesale price inflation rises marginally to 0.83% in December
items.summary: Data released earlier this week showed the country’s retail inflation inched up to 1.33% in December, from 0.71% in November, driven by rising food prices.

items.title: Indian Oil buys 2 million barrels of Ecuadorean oil via tender, sources say
items.summary: Indian Oil Corporation has secured its first cargo of Ecuadorean Oriente crude for delivery by the end of March. This strategic purchase aims to diversify the nation's oil imports. The move comes as global sanctions disrupt Russian oil supplies. Indian refiners are actively seeking alternative sources to meet their energy demands.

items.title: Budget 2026: Luxury booms, affordable busts and why budget is a housing make-or-break
items.summary: Union Budget 2026: India Budget holds the key to resolving a growing housing affordability crisis. Luxury homes are booming, but affordable housing supply is shrinking. Developers are shifting to premium projects due to low margins in affordable segments. Policy changes are needed to redefine affordable housing and revive incentives. Infrastructure development is also vital.

items.title: Paint stocks fall up to 2% amid four-day crude oil rally; Asian Paints top loser
items.summary: Indian paint stocks, including Asian Paints and Berger Paints, fell on January 14 due to rising crude oil prices. Asian Paints shares dropped 2.1%, while Brent and WTI crude futures saw significant gains amid escalating tensions in Iran.

items.title: IT sector poised for better days ahead, financials to outperform: Chakri Lokapriya
items.summary: Indian equity markets are in a wait-and-watch mode, awaiting clarity on tariffs and the Union Budget's capital expenditure focus. CIO-Equities Chakri Lokapriya highlights selective opportunities in sectors like IT, metals, and banking, while advising caution on insurance and quick commerce due to persistent competitive pressures and margin concerns.

items.title: Is the Indian stock market open or closed tomorrow?
items.summary: BSE and NSE announced that Thursday, January 15, will be a trading holiday in the equity and equity derivatives segment on account of the Municipal Corporation Election in Maharashtra.

items.title: Nestlé CEO apologises over instant formula recall
items.summary: Navratil said ​all recalls ⁠have now been announced

items.title: Is it time for RBI to pay attention to yield signals from the bond market for its monetary policy?
items.summary: Our bond market seems unmoved by repeated repo rate cuts in 2025, with the 10-year G-Sec yield settling into a stubborn range. Is this a policy transmission failure—or the market signalling that rates are where they should be? The answer may depend on RBI’s view of the efficient market hypothesis

items.title: Venezuela turmoil unlikely to materially impact India’s crude oil imports
items.summary: However, the recent developments in Venezuela threatens India’s efforts to gain access to important minerals such as Lithium, Rare Earths, nickel and gold.

items.summary: Union Bank of India Q3 Results:Union Bank of India reported a 9% YoY increase in Q3 net profit to  ₹5,017 crore. Net interest income rose by 1% to  ₹9,328 crore. Gross NPA decreased to 3.06%, and total business grew 5.04% YoY, reaching  ₹22,39,740 crore.

items.summary: Surge primarily driven by large-ticket transactions, which accounted for 45% of total demand

items.title: Telcos allege ‘market failure’ at Navi Mumbai airport, ask Trai to cap infrastructure costs
items.summary: The Cellular Operators Association of India has petitioned the regulator to enforce a cost-based pricing framework, accusing the Adani-run airport of bypassing Telecom Act rules to install monopolistic gatekeepers.

items.summary: Groww Q3FY26 Results: Groww parent Billionbrains Garage Ventures reported a 27.8% YoY drop in consolidated profit for Q3 FY26, impacted by a one-time gain in the base quarter. Revenue rose 24.8% YoY, and the platform continued to gain traction with strong growth in active users, market share, customer assets and trading activity across segments.

items.title: Multibagger stock jumps 7% from intraday's low following Dalal Street rebound
items.summary: Elitecon International shares rose 7% amid a market recovery, reaching an intraday high of  ₹87. The company's board is exploring a strategic merger to enhance synergies, supported by Deloitte. Q2 FY2026 saw operational income soar to  ₹5,056.75 crore, with a net profit increase of 129%.

items.title: Ireda shines in December quarter, but NPA risks remain
items.summary: IREDA’s Q3 profit jumped 38% on strong interest income and lower funding costs, but legacy NPAs and lumpy exposures continue to cloud the outlook.

items.title: Union Budget 2026 around the corner — How should stock market investors position themselves ahead of the mega event?
items.summary: Stalled trade deal, fresh tariff threats by US President Donald Trump and relentless selling by foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) have kept the stock market sentiment subdued in January so far. The Nifty 50 index is already down 1.4% during the first 10 trading days of the year.

items.title: Chabahar, crude and chaos: The broader impact of the US‑Iran tensions on India
items.summary: Trump’s 25% tariff on countries trading with Iran, plus possible US intervention, could threaten India’s Chabahar Port investment and stir global oil price volatility, even as trade with Iran remains minimal.

items.title: Bitcoin rally sees $600 million in bearish crypto bets wiped out
items.summary: Bitcoin slumped to a loss of more than 6% for 2025 after ending the year in muted fashion, trading in a narrow range and proving largely indifferent to rallies in stocks and precious metals

items.title: Wholesale price inflation accelerates 0.83% in December
items.summary: Inflation in December picked ⁠up primarily due to an increase in the cost of ​manufacturing in ⁠sectors such machinery, food products and textiles, a government statement said

items.title: Over 150% returns in one year! Small-cap multibagger stock hits upper circuit despite weak markets
items.summary: The small-cap stock opened in the red at  ₹31.28 in the early morning session on Wednesday. However, the stock pared losses, gained nearly 10% from the intraday low level.

items.title: Miners, energy stocks hold Australian benchmark at 2-month closing high
items.summary: Indian shares reached a two-month peak on Wednesday. Heavyweight miners and energy stocks saw gains due to rising commodity prices. However, a sharp fall in major banks limited the overall advance. Top miners BHP and Rio Tinto advanced. Gold miners also closed at a peak. Energy stocks climbed significantly. In New Zealand, the benchmark S&P/NZX 50 index ended higher.

items.title: US Supreme Court tariff decision in focus: Can a ruling against Trump trigger a rally in the Indian stock market?
items.summary: The impending US Supreme Court ruling on Trump’s tariffs could influence the Indian stock market. Experts, however, suggest any positive impact may be limited, as tariffs remain central to Trump's strategy.&nbsp;

items.title: Why Ryanair’s hard-nosed efficiency is a lesson for no-frill Indian air carriers like IndiGo
items.summary: After a bruising year, India’s airlines are searching for a reset. Ryanair offers a lesson: brutal cost discipline and a clear compact with passengers can deliver profits and reliability. India’s low-cost carriers like IndiGo could learn a thing or two from it.

items.title: Sebi clears Kissht, Alcobrew Distilleries and 4 other companies for IPO. Check full list
items.summary: Sebi has approved six companies, including Kissht, Alcobrew Distilleries and Indo MIM, to raise funds via IPOs over the next year. The offerings include fresh issues and promoter sales, with proceeds aimed at expansion, acquisitions, debt repayment, and corporate purposes. Key IPO dates, price bands, and lot sizes are yet to be announced.

items.title: Puravankara shares rally 12% as Q3 sales, collections jump, breaking the slump for the realty stock
items.summary: Puravankara shares jumped more than 12% after the real estate developer reported strong double-digit growth in Q3 sales value and collections, aided by higher realisations, steady deliveries and fresh land additions across key markets. The rally snapped a five-day losing streak for the stock, though it remains sharply lower over the past year.

items.title: Budget 2026: The missing tax framework for India’s outbound M&A wave
items.summary: Budget 2026 Expectations: Indian corporates are increasingly pursuing outbound investments for market expansion and technology acquisition. However, the current tax and regulatory framework lags behind, necessitating reforms to support global ambitions. Key areas for improvement include clearer tax deductions on interest, tax neutrality for overseas mergers, and expanded DTAA networks.

items.title: Tata Elxsi Q3 PAT slumps 45% YoY; brokerages flag 22% downside risk — here’s what they say
items.summary: Tata Elxsi's net profit plunged 45.3% due to a one-time labour law charge. While revenue and margins showed some strength, brokerages remain divided. Some see potential in auto and healthcare recovery, while others cite rich valuations and muted visibility in key segments, leading to cautious or sell ratings.

items.title: China’s trade surplus hits record $1.2 trillion amid rising exports
items.summary: Economists expect exports will continue to support China’s economy this year, despite trade friction and geopolitical tensions

items.title: India’s wholesale inflation ticks up to 8-month high of 0.83% in Dec after contracting 0.32% in Nov
items.summary: India’s wholesale price inflation rose to 0.83% in December from a 0.32% contraction in November, exceeding market expectations of 0.30%, government data showed. Retail inflation also edged up to a three-month high of about 1.3% in December as food deflation eased, though it remained below the RBI’s 4% target for the fourth straight month.

items.title: Will the stock market crash in 2026?
items.summary: The new year started with positive sentiment, with the Nifty scaling an all-time high. However the past week delivered a big blow. With the Nifty taking a tumble, investors are beginning to wonder if the much-anticipated correction is finally here.

items.title: Will Trump be the uninvited guest at Sitharaman’s Budget table?
items.summary: Budget 2026 will reflect Donald Trump's undeniable imprint, shaping India's export assumptions and economic priorities amidst a challenging global trade environment. Facing punitive US tariffs and potential sanctions, India's focus shifts to domestic competitiveness and resilience to navigate geopolitical trade pressures and achieve export growth.

items.title: 2026 will be the year of geopolitics, not AI; Emerging markets still resilient: Geoff Dennis
items.summary: Geopolitics, not AI, may dominate markets in 2026, says emerging markets expert Geoff Dennis. Despite global tensions, emerging markets are outperforming even as oil prices rise and the dollar strengthens. Dennis expects only limited Fed rate cuts, warns of geopolitical flashpoints, and explains why EMs could remain the “flavour of the year.”

items.title: China posts record $1.2 trillion trade surplus in 2025 as December exports rise 6.6%
items.summary: China's trade surplus reached a record $1.2 trillion in 2025, driven by a 5.5% rise in exports, while imports remained stagnant.

items.title: Shadowfax IPO to open on Jan 22 with a price band of ₹118-124/share
items.summary: The IPO will comprise a fresh issue of shares worth ₹1,000 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of ₹907.27 crore by existing shareholders. This takes the total issue size to ₹1,907.27 crore

items.title: Aluminium, copper settle after bull run into 2026

items.title: Fed probe rekindles diversification debate as investors weigh ‘Sell USA’ risks
items.summary: A U.S. Justice Department probe into Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell is sparking renewed investor interest in diversifying portfolios away from America. While markets remain calm, concerns about the Fed's independence are growing, potentially leading to gradual shifts in global capital allocation. This development adds to existing worries about U.S. fiscal health and debt.

items.title: Budget 2026 to double down on defence? Motilal Oswal flags capex winners, yield risks ahead of FY27
items.summary: Motilal Oswal expects Budget 2026 to reinforce defence-led capital expenditure while maintaining fiscal discipline. With limited tax relief, reliance on RBI dividends and elevated borrowing, the brokerage flags capex-linked sectors as equity winners and warns of range-bound bond yields in FY27.

items.summary: Amazon ‍said it held discussions with some ​vendors about adjusting costs to reflect the ‌reduction in tariff rates

items.title: Will Budget revive capex stocks? What defence, rail and infra investors should watch
items.summary: The Union Budget on February 1 is shaping up as a litmus test for the capex trade, which has slowed over the past year. With fiscal discipline likely to be maintained, any additional spending is expected to be selective, focusing on sectors such as defence, railways, and infrastructure-linked segments, rather than a broad-based capital expenditure push.

items.title: Objective is to ensure choice to customers as per their needs: Pension regulator chief on seeking tax neutrality across all NPS payout plans
items.summary: The PFRDA has urged the government to accord a tax-neutral status across all NPS pension payout plans beyond the traditional annuities.

items.summary: The dollar index, which measures the greenback’s strength against a basket of six currencies, was trading 0.01% lower at 98.90

items.title: Bitcoin trades near $95K as softer US inflation and global tensions boost safe-haven demand
items.summary: Bitcoin surged near $95,000, fueled by stable US inflation data and geopolitical unease driving demand for safe havens. Cryptocurrencies like Ethereum and major altcoins also saw significant gains. Analysts note improving market liquidity and a shift towards risk assets, with on-chain data suggesting easing selling pressure and potential for further upside.

items.title: M.S. Dhoni-backed Garuda Aerospace and BEL sign MoU
items.summary: The MoU establishes a framework for cooperation wherein BEL will act as the Team Leader and Lead Bidder, while Garuda Aerospace will serve as the Technology and Teaming Partner

items.title: US inflation firms up in December, keeping Fed in wait-and-watch mode
items.summary: U.S. consumer inflation edged up 0.3% in December, keeping year-on-year CPI at 2.7%, reinforcing expectations that the Federal Reserve will maintain a wait-and-watch approach. While price pressures remain above target, the data suggests a gradual disinflationary trend, providing markets with reassurance without prompting an immediate shift in monetary policy.

items.title: When is Union Budget of India? Date, time & key details
items.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will present India’s Union Budget 2026-27 on February 1, 2026, at 11 am.

items.title: Import squeeze, not demand boom, drives India’s steel export shift
items.summary: India emerged as a net exporter of finished steel in April–December 2025 as safeguard duties and quality curbs sharply cut imports, even as exports rose amid weak domestic prices and surplus supply.

items.title: Nomura initiates coverage on ITC Hotels, IHCL with Buy rating. Check target price, upside potential
items.summary: Nomura has initiated coverage on ITC Hotels and Indian Hotels Company with a Buy rating, citing strong demand trends and asset-light expansion. Revenue grew marginally, while adjusted profit declined 5.4%, reflecting continued pressure on margins despite steady demand in software services.

items.title: Stock Market Holiday 2026: Are BSE, NSE closed for Maharashtra municipal elections?
items.summary: NSE Holidays 2026: Indian stock markets will be closed on January 15 due to municipal elections in Maharashtra, a change from the initial settlement holiday classification.
